msItem.colophon:
ተጽሕፈ፡ ዝንቱ፡ መጽሐፍ፡ በ፲፡ ወ፱፻፤ ዓመተ፡ ምሕረት፤ በዘመነ፤ ዮሐንስ፡ ወንጌላዊ፡ እንዘ፡ ዓበቅቴ ፳፰፣ ወመጥቅዕ፤ ፪፤ ውእቱ፡ በ፲፡ ወ፱፡ ዓመተ፡ መንግሥቱ፡ ለምኒልክ፡ ንጉሠ፡ ነገሥት፡ ዘኢትዮጵያ፡ ለዘአጽሐፎ፤ ደጃዝማች፡ ወሊ፡ ዘወረባቦ፡ ወለጸሐፊሁ፤ ቀኝ፡ ጌታ፡ መኮነን፡ ዘመካነ፡ ሰማዕት፤ ገላውዲዎስ፤ ኅቡረ፡ ይምሐሮሙ፤ እግዚአብሔር፡ በመንግሥተ፡ ሰማያት፡ ለዓለመ፡ ዓለም፡ አሜን፤ ለይኩን፠ This book was written in the year of mercy 1900, in the year of John the Evangelist, while ʿābaqte was 28 and maṭqʿǝ 2, in the 19th year of reign of Mǝnilǝk, King of Kings of Ethiopia. May God in the Kingdom of Heaven have mercy on them together, daǧǧāzmāč Wale of Warrabābbo who commissioned the writing and his scribe qaññ getā Makonnan from Makāna Samāʿt Galāwdewos. Forever and ever, Amen.
According to the colophon the manuscript was written in 1900 year of mercy, in the year of John the Evangelist. It mentions the commissioner daǧǧāzmāč Wale of Warrabābbo (Wallo), the scribe
qaññ getā Makonnan and the place of the latter’s affiliation, Makāna Samāʿt Galāwdewos (Nač̣č̣ Śār, Wallo).

handNote.desc:
Fine and careful. The letter ች in the word ደጃዝማች (daǧǧāzmāč) has a particular shape, on .
According to the colophon, the manuscript was copied by qaññ getāMakonnan of Makāna Samāʿt Galāwdewos in Nač̣č̣ Śār. He also copied the Psalter , for the same commissioner. Most likely the same scribe wrote manuscript .

decoDesc.decoNote:
Elaborate ornamental bands separate from each other: a group of 10 Psalms, Maḥālǝya nabiyāt, Maḥālǝya maḥālǝy and Wǝddāse Māryām. At the top of some of them, there is a miniature illustrating one of the psalms from the group, most often the first one. On the subsequent folium, a relevant verse from the psalm is written on a yellow background within a red frame.
Elaborate coloured (red, yellow, violet, green and blue) ornamental band with two lateral pendants pointed up and two pointed down; interlaces, and floral motifs. At the top a floral motif between two crosses interlaced with floral motifs.

Elaborate coloured (red, yellow, violet, green and blue) ornamental band with two lateral pendants pointed up and two pointed down; interlaces and floral motifs (similar to the band on ). At the top, an illustration of Psalm 11:2 depicting two hypocrite men talking to each other. They exchange a warm handshake with their right hands, while one of the men points an accusatory finger to the other. On , legends written on a yellow background within a red frame: ከንቶ፡ ይትናገሩ፡ ፩ ምስለ፡ ካልዑ (Psalm 11:2) They speak vanity every one with his neighbour. In Amharic: ይህ፡ ነው፡This is it.

Elaborate coloured (red, yellow, violet, rosy, orange, green and blue) ornamental band with two lateral pendants pointed up and two pointed down; interlaces and floral motifs (similar to the band on ). At the top, an illustration of Psalm 22: 18: four men casting lots. The band is protected by a textile curtain. On , legend written on a yellow background within a red frame: ወተካፈሉ፡ አልባስየ፡ ለርእሶሙ፦ ወተዓፀው፡ ዲበ፡ ዓራዝየ፦ ፬፡ ሐራ፡ ሰገራት፦ (Psalm 22: 18) They part my garments among them, and cast lots for my clothing. In Amharic: ይህ፡ ነው፡ This is it.

Elaborate coloured (red, yellow, violet, rosy, orange, green and blue) ornamental band with two lateral pendants pointed up and two pointed down; interlaces and floral motifs (similar to the band on ). At the top, an illustration of Psalm 33:17: a man fallen from a fleeing horse. The band is protected by a textile curtain. On , legend written on a yellow background within a red frame: ፈረሰኒ፡ ሐሰት፡ ኢያድኅን፡ ወኢያመስጥ፡ በብዝኃ፡ ጽንዑ (Psalm 33:17) A horse is a vain thing for safety: neither shall he deliver any by his great strength. In Amharic: ይህ፡ ነው፡ This is it.

Elaborate coloured (violet, orange, green and red) ornamental band with two lateral pendants pointed up and two pointed down; interlaces and floral motifs. At the top, a hart (a deer) giving birth and crying from pain; on both her sides are brooks. The hart is mentioned in Psalm 42: 1. The band is protected by a textile curtain. On , legend written on a yellow background within a red frame, in Amharic: ኃየል፡ ማለት፡ ዋልያ፡ ናት፡ የዋልያ፡ ምጽ፡ ይህ፡ ነው፡ Ḫāyal means a deer. Deer’s birth pangs are these.

Elaborate coloured (violet, rosy, yellow, orange, green, light blue and red) ornamental band with two lateral pendants pointed up and two pointed down; interlaces and floral motifs. At the top, most probably flowering olive trees (illustration of Psalm 52:8): But I am like a green olive tree in the house of God: I trust in the mercy of God forever and ever.

Elaborate coloured (violet, rosy, yellow, orange, green, light blue and red) ornamental band with two lateral pendants pointed up and two pointed down; interlaces and floral motifs. At the top, floral motifs and two crosses.

decoNote.desc: Prophet Samuel anoints King David in the presence of Jesse (1 Sm. 16). ወነሥአኒ፡ እምአባግዐ፡ አቡየ፨ ወቀብዐኒ፡ ቅብዐ፡ ቅዱስ፦ አኃውየሰ፡ ሠናያን፡ ወልሂቃን፦ ወኢሠምረ፡ ቦሙ፡ እግዚአብሔር፦ (Psalm 151: 4-5) And took me from my father’s sheep, and anointed me with his anointing-oil. My brothers were handsome and tall, but the Lord was not pleased with them. In Amharic: ያሰኘው፡ ይህ፡ ነው፡ This is what he meant. The miniature is protected by a textile curtain.

A miniature of . ይቤ፡ ዳዊት፡ በመዝሙር። ሰብእሰ፡ ከንቶ፡ ይመስል፦ ወመዋዕሊሁኒ፡ ከመ፡ ጽላሎት፡ የኃልፍ፨ (Psalm 144: 4) Man is like to vanity: his days [are] as a shadow that passes away., ወካዕቤ፡ ይቤ። እደውየ፡ ይገብራ፡ መሰንቆ፤ ወአፃብዕየ፡ ያስተዋድዶ፡ መዝሙረ፨ (Psalm 151: 2) My hands made a harp; my fingers fashioned a lyre.

A miniature of the : Daǧǧāzmāč reading the God’s Law. (Passages from Psalm 1) ብፁዕ፡ ብእሲ፡ ደጃዝማች፡ ወሊ። ዘኢሖረ፡ በምክረ፡ ረሲዓን፨ ወዘሕጎ፡ ያነብብ፡ መዓልተ፡ ወሌሊተ፨ ወይከውን፡ ከመ፡ ዕፅ፤ እንተ፡ ትክልት፡ ኀበ፡ ሙሐዘ፡ ማይ፤ እንተ፡ ትሁብ፡ ፍሬሃ፡ በበጊዜሃ፤ ውእቱኒ፡ ከማሃ፨ Blessed is Daǧǧāzmāč Wale. Nor stands in the way of sinners. And in his law does he meditate day and night. And he shall be like a tree planted by the rivers of water, that brings forth its fruit in its season. He too is like it. In Amharic: ይህ፡ ነው፡ This is it. The miniature is protected by a textile curtain.

An with two swords. Illustration of Psalm 34:7, The angel of the Lord encamps round about them that fear him, and delivers them. The miniature is protected by a textile curtain.

Two men sitting on cushions symbolizing lightness or vanity. One of them holds scales with a ball symbolizing man’s life on the lighter scale pan and a few balls symbolizing vanity on the heavier scale pan. Illustration of the initial Psalm of the group of Psalms 62–71. ሐሳውያን፡ ደቂቀ፡ እጓለ፡ እምሕያው፡ ይዒምፁ፡ መዳልወ፡ እሙንቱሰ፡ እምከንቱ፡ ውስተ፡ ከንቱ፡ ክመ፡ (Psalm 62:9) Surely men of low degree are vanity, and men of high degree are a lie: if laid on the balance, they are altogether lighter than vanity. In Amharic: ይህ፡ ነው፡ This is it.

Adoration of the Magi. Illustration of the initial Psalm of a group 72–81. (Lk 2 :13) ወግብተ፡ መጽኡ፡ ሐራ፡ ሰማይ And […] there was […] a multitude of the heavenly host., ቤተ፡ ልሔም፡ Bethlehem, ኮከብ፡ መርሆሙ The Star led them., ነገሥተ፡ ተርሲስ፡ ወደሰያት፡ አምኃ፡ ያበውዑ፤ ነገሥተ፡ ሳባ፡ ወአረብ፡ ጋዳ፡ ያመጽኡ፡ (Psalm 72:10) The kings of Tarshish and of the coasts shall bring presents: the kings of Sheba and ʾArab shall offer gifts.The miniature is protected by a textile curtain.
(above) The fall of the .አንትሙሰ፡ ከመ፡ ሰብእ፡ ትመውቱ። ወከመ፡ ፩ እመላእክት፡ ትወድቁ፡ (Psalm 82:7) But you shall die like men, and fall like one of the princes. In Amharic: ይህ፡ ነው፡ This is it.

(below) Mourners with the deceased between the devils (on the left) and the angels (on the right). መላእክተ፡ ጽልመት The Angel of Darkness., መላእክተ፡ ብርሃን The Angel of Light. The miniature is protected by a textile curtain.
Two angels. Illustration of Psalm 91:11 , For he shall give his angels charge over you, to keep you in all your ways.

A kind of donkey, a bird in a house, a hermit. ወኮንኩ፡ ከመ፡ ዓድገ፡ መረብ፡ ዘገዳም፦ (Psalm 102:6) I am like a vulture of the wilderness. In the Gǝʿǝz translation ‘a vulture’ is ዓድገ፡ መረብ, ‘a pelican’, but the painter associated ዓድገ with ዓድጊ, which means ‘donkey’ in Tigrinya. In Amharic ይህ፡ ነው፡ This is it., ዖፍ፡ ባሕታዊ፡ ውስተ፡ ናሕስ፦ (Psalm 102:7 a sparrow alone upon the house top. In Amharic ይህ፡ ነው This is it., ብእሲ፡ ባሕታዊ፡ ይህ፡ ነው This is a hermit. The miniature is protected by a textile curtain.

A round church between two trees. In the foreground on the left: ደጃች ወሊ (daǧǧāč Wali ) with a prayer book, and on the right: ወይዘሮ ስሂን (wayzaro Sǝhin) with a string of prayer beads. ወቆማ፡ አገሪነ፡ ውስተ፡ አዕፃድኪ፡ ኢየሩሳሌም፡ (Psalm 122:2) Our feet shall stand within your gates, O Jerusalem. In Amharic: ይህ፡ ነው፡ This is it. The miniature is protected by a textile curtain.

A little face surrounded by a chain. A little face surrounded by a chain (an illustration of Psalm 142:7 Bring my soul out of prison). In Amharic: ያሰኘው፡ ይህ፡ ነው This is what he meant. The same face is painted in the same place on the reverse side ().

and defeated , giving the armour to David. አንሰ፡ ነሣእኩ፡ ፫ተ፡ አዕባነ፡ እም፡ ውስተ፡ ፈለግ፡ ወወፀፍክዎ፡ እንተ፡ ፍጽሙ፠ አሚሃ፡ ወድቀ፡ በኃይለ፡ እግዚአብሔር፡ ጎልያድ፡ ያርብሐዊ። (Psalm 151: between 6 and 7, verses not present in the Septuagint) I took three stones out of the brook (cf. 1 Sm. 17: 40) And I slung it in his forehead; At that moment he fell down by the power of God; Gigantic Goliath (cf. 1 Sam. 17:49). In Amharic: ይህ፡ ነው፡ This is it. ለእመ፡ ወሀቦ፡ ወልታ፡ ወኵናተ፧ ይቤ፡ ዳዊት፡ ኢለመድኩ፡ በዝ፡ ግብር (1 Sam. 17:39) When he gave him a shield and a spear David said, ‘I am not accustomed to using it. ልብሱ፡ ለጎልያድ፡ ጥሩር፡ ውእቱ፡ Goliath’s clothing was armour.

Pharaoh and his host are drowning in the ; Archangel Mikāʾel in a cloud; with a rod and the Israelites; beating the timbrel. ሠረገላቲሁ፡ ለፈርዖን፡ ወሠራዊቶ፡ ወረወ፡ ውስተ፡ ባሕር፡ ወተሠጥሙ፡ ውስተ፡ ባሕረ፡ ኤርትራ፡(Ex 15:4) Pharaoh’s chariots and his host has he cast into the sea: they are drowned in the Red Sea. In Amharic: ይህ፡ ነው፡ This is it. ወይቤሎ፡ ሚካኤል፡ ለሙሴ፡ ዝብጣ፡ ለባሕር፡ And Mikāʾel said to Moses ‘Strike the sea.’ (cf. Ex. 14:19). እኅተ፡ ሙሴ፡ ዘበጠት፡ ከበሮ፡ Moses’ ‘Sister beat the timbrel’ (cf. Ex. 15:20).

Prophet Simeon with the child Jesus, Mary and Joseph in the Temple ልደተ፡ ስምዖን፡ ነቢይ Birth of Prophet Simeon. In Amharic: ይህ፡ ነው፡ This is it. ዘከመ፡ ቦዓ፡ እግዚእነ፡ በ፵፡ ዕለት፡ ቤተ፡ መቅደስ፡ እኂዞ፡ እጓለ፡ ርግብ፦ As the Lady entered the Temple in the 40th day with a baby dove. (cfLk 2 :24.

Judgement of King Solomon. King Solomon, two mothers, the deceased child and two soldiers about to divide the living child into two. በከመ፡ ፈትሐ። ንጉሥ፡ ሰሎሞን። ወይቤ፡ ቅትልዎ፡ ለሕፃን፡ ወሀቦ፡ መንፈቆ፡ ለዛቲ፡ ወመንፈቆ፡ ለእንታክቲ፡ (1 Kings 3:25) How judged King Solomon and said, ‘Kill the child and give half to the one, and half to the other’. In Amharic: ይህ ነው This is it. ቤተ፡ ንጉሥ፡ The King’s Palace. The miniature is protected by a textile curtain.

St. Mary with and behind Her, St. Ephraim and a beggar. አዳም፡ ወሄዋን፡ Adam and Eve, ወድሰኒ፡ ትቤሎ፡ She says to him: ‘Praise me’, ባርክኒ፡ ይቤላ፡, He says to her: ‘Bless me’, ኤፍሬም፡ ለብሐዊ፡ Efraim the Potter, ፩፡ ነዳይ ፡ተመጽዋቲ፡ A beggar, almsperson. The miniature is protected by a textile curtain.

item.desc: Purchase note; it is written on a single loose leaf attached to the inner side of the front board. Its ruling pattern is different from that of the manuscript. It is questionable if the leaf originally belonged to the book since its commissioner and scribe are different from those mentioned here. The note mentions ʾAbbā Zamikāʾel as the owner and ʾAśrāta Māryām as the scribe. ʾAśrāta Māryām seems to have written only this note in the present manuscript .

This book was purchase by ʾAbbā Zamikāʾel with his own money and was written by ʾAśrāta Māryām so that it might become for them a guide to the Kingdom of Heaven. Priests and deacons, do not take out this book from the sanctuary and do not spoil [it] as you spoiled many prayer books; may all the saints whose names are mentioned in this book be with the children of Dāmmo, major and minor; forever and ever. Amen.

This Psalter was donated to Dabra Dāmmo by Rās Mikāʾel so that it might become salvation for his soul. He who will steal it or erase (its text) shall be excommunicated by the authority of Peter and Paul.

origin.origDate: According to the colophon, the manuscript was completed in 1900 year of mercy (= 1908 A.D.), in the 19th year of reign of King Mǝnilǝk II (r. 1889–1913).

history.provenance: According to the colophon, the original commissioner was daǧǧāzmāč Wale of Warrabābbo, baptismal name Walda Mikāʾel, s. (He may be identified with Wale Bǝṭul d. 1918; in 1900 he was already ‘Rās’). He is also depicted on the miniatures, . In the 20th cent. Warrabābbo or Warra Bābbo was a warada in Ambāssal awrāğğā. A few individuals, both diseased and living, including Walda Mikāʾel, Walatta Kidān and the late King Yoḥannǝs (most likely Yoḥannǝs IV), are mentioned in the supplication formulas at the end of . Additionally, Kǝfla Yāʿqob is mentioned in the supplication formulas written in a small script on . The manuscript is similar to the Psalter from Dabra Ḥayq ʾƎsṭifānos, Wallo, completed by the same scribe ( qaññ getā Makonnan) and commissioned by the same person, daǧǧāzmāč Wale.
